name: Royal Marine Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I spent 4 nights in this lovely hotel. Yes, with the Euro rate Dublin is expensive for the British but just put that to one side and enjoy yourselves.
reviews.title: Great Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel gives you plenty of areas to just relax and wind down. It has a beautiful pool area with sauna, steam room and whirl pool. Please note that a swimming cap is required for all bathers using the pool, these can be bought for 5euros at reception.
reviews.title: Great Value For Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hardys Bar is perfect for a night cap after a busy time in Dublin City.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the Dart train system to get into town which was very regular, very reliable, very quick, and surprisingly cheap. Station is only a few minutes from the hotel, That's if you don't stop at The Bodaga Wine Bar on the way. One thing I did notice about the trains too were their cleanliness, no matter what time of day or night the trains were very clean.
reviews.title: Great alternative to staying in Center City Dublin

likes.disliked: — The attentive staff seemed to want you to sit and buy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, back to the hotel, Our room was on the ground floor at the rear with no view at all except a small garden with a few trees and a high wall, But,,, how long do you want to be in your hotel room except to wash change and sleep? Walk a few metres to reception area and there you can have a drink while overlooking Dun Leary bay.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal Marine Hotel was the absolute best hotel I have stayed in during my past three visits to Europe. First of all the staff is extremely friendly, respectful, and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and in a great neighborhood in the Dublin suburb of Dun Laoghire. Our room was very spacious compared to other rooms in Europe and the bed was as comfortable as could be. Our room was quiet and very relaxing after a long day in the city. The bathroom was large and had nightlights which was great for not walking into things. The hotel itself is outside of Dublin but you can catch the DART commuter train by making a right at the main street and walking down to the corner. Access to the city was quite simple. My wife and I bought a one week pass and used the train every day to get to the City Center. Travel to and from the airport was simple. We just took the Patten Flyer bus from the airport directly to the hotel and vice versa on the way back; 7 euros per person.
reviews.title: Loved the Royal Marine Hotel

likes.liked: — The size and quality of our room and the courteous customer service
likes.disliked: — High priced menu for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. And the rude bartender.

reviews.text: The only thing I did not like about the hotel was the high priced breakfast and a certain rude bartender but overall my experience with this hotel was very positive. If I go back to Dublin I plan on staying there again and would recommend it people who want a quiet night's sleep.
reviews.title: Poor location for Dublin visit

reviews.text: We stayed at The Royal Marine for two nights as part of a tour group. This accommodation is located in a Dublin suburb a considerable distance from Central City and the airport. It is well served by light rail and by the excellent Dublin city bus service. It is within walking distance of the ferry (to England) terminal.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal Marine is an older facility which has been reasonably well maintaind. The service was good, although frequently provided by staff with limited English language skills. It should be noted that of the considerable number of hotels and B&B's that we stayed at in Ireland, this was the only place that felt that it was appropriate to charge their guests for Internet Service - definitely a turnoff!!!
reviews.title: Lovely weekend stay

likes.disliked: — A bit pricey for our taste

reviews.text: This facility is pricey if you are travelling alone. You should be able to find a comparable facility more convenient to the city at the same or better price.
reviews.title: Good value compared with Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Royal Marine. We booked through CentralR.com and got a good rate. The room was beautiful and very comfortable. You can get the Patton Flyer Shuttle at the airport and be let off right in front of the hotel. It is a short walk to the DART station (into Dublin) and the town of Dun Laoghaire is a lot of fun! We didnt get a chance to use any of the spa or pool because we kept busy sight-seeing in Dublin. But this would be a nice place to go to relax for a few days! Loved it. The staff was friendly, although sometimes not sure how much English they spoke. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Royal Marine

description: Steeped in history and a favourite with the locals, this landmark Hotel is an impressive sight on the Dun Laoghaire skyline. Since 1828, a Dublin Hotel has occupied the site now occupied by the Dun Laoghaire, Royal Marine Hotel. With 228 Bedrooms, 14 Dedicated Meeting Rooms and a Conference Centre as well as The Pier Health Club and sananaSPA; the Royal Marine Hotel has it all.
